meanings.definition: To rearrange or adjust the spacing of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to respace the chairs in the classroom to create more room.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer decided to respace the furniture for a better layout.
meanings.sent3: Trying to respace the books on the shelf turned into a game of Tetris.
meanings.sent4: She had to respace her schedule to fit in the unexpected meeting.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were like words that needed to be respace to form a coherent sentence.

meanings.definition: To allocate or designate space for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The city council will respace the park for a new playground area.
meanings.sent2: The architect had to respace the rooms in the building to accommodate more offices.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to respace the ingredients on the counter to make room for the new recipe.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to respace the desks to create a collaborative learning environment.
meanings.sent5: The gardener needed to respace the plants to allow each one to receive enough sunlight.
